definition: to dispatch a vehicle/(of a vehicle or its driver) to set off

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
surname Che
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)

sentences.english: The driver delayed the drive until the weather cleared.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員延遲到天氣轉晴後纔出車。

sentences.english: She leaned out of the window and hailed a passerby.
sentences.chinese: 她探出車窗口，向一個過路人打招呼。

sentences.english: The passenger slowly climbed out toinvestigate.
sentences.chinese: 那名乘客慢慢地爬出車去查看。

sentences.english: These accidents always cause traffic jams on rainy days.
sentences.chinese: 下雨天出車禍往往引起堵車。

sentences.english: He says he got out of his car with his gun.
sentences.chinese: 他說他拿着槍爬出車，開了四槍打死了那個人。

sentences.english: Eventually, I was let out of the car and cited for disorderly conduct.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我被拉出車，並被以“行爲不撿”被傳喚。

sentences.english: What if I get into a car accident right now?
After the accident,the car was bent up in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 出車禍後，那輛車亂轉了。

sentences.english: The reason why the traffic was blocked was that an accident happened ahead.
sentences.chinese: 交通受阻的原因就是前面出車禍了。

sentences.english: She doesn't answer; she's thinking about throwing herself out of the car.
sentences.chinese: 她沒有回答，她在想着怎樣把自己扔出車外。

sentences.english: You're heading for an accident if you drive after drinking.
sentences.chinese: 如果你酒後開車，會闖出車禍。

sentences.english: If you drive too fast, you may get into a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 如果你車開太快的話，你有可能會出車禍。

sentences.english: You can drive tonight if you are ready。
sentences.chinese: 你今晚就可以出車，如果你願意的話。

sentences.english: The brakes wouldn't act, so there was an accident.
sentences.chinese: 剎車不起作用了，所以纔出車禍。

sentences.english: Bright flash from the track can clearly determine the speed of the bus.
sentences.chinese: 從亮點閃過惪軌跡中可明顯地判斷出車惪速度。

sentences.english: Grab the keys from the kidnapper's car and throw them out the window.
sentences.chinese: 搶到綁匪的車鑰匙扔出車窗外。

definition: (of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
army provisions/rations and fodder
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
to be close friends
to be late/to arrive slowly/to be slow in the coming
cock fighting
to answer the door
Guoxing or Kuohsing township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
motor racetrack/cycle racetrack
danger lurks on every side (idiom)
to drive a cart
general matters/division of general affairs/person in overall charge
calm and composed (idiom)
writing on the ground with a large brush dipped in water
to stand guard/to serve on sentry duty
(old) commanding general/commander-in-chief/(Qing dynasty) title for a governor-general (provincial military governor) 總督|总督[zong3 du1]
